questions.question_text: How often have you been bothered by feeling down, depressed, or hopeless?
How often have you had trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much?
How often have you felt tired or had little energy?
How often have you had trouble concentrating on things?
How often have you had thoughts that you would be better off dead?

interpretations.title: Minimal Symptoms
interpretations.description: You're showing minimal signs of depression or anxiety. Your responses suggest you're managing well overall with good mental health indicators.
recommendations: Continue maintaining your current healthy habits
Keep up regular exercise and social connections
Practice stress management techniques like meditation
Monitor your mood and seek support if things change

interpretations.title: Mild to Moderate Symptoms
interpretations.description: You're experiencing some symptoms that may be affecting your daily life. This is common and there are effective ways to address these feelings.
recommendations: Consider speaking with a counselor or therapist
Reach out to trusted friends or family members
Establish regular sleep and exercise routines
Practice relaxation techniques like deep breathing
Consider mindfulness or meditation apps
If symptoms persist, consult with a healthcare provider

interpretations.title: Moderate to Severe Symptoms - Please Seek Help
interpretations.description: Your responses indicate you may be experiencing significant depression or anxiety symptoms. It's important to reach out for professional support - you don't have to handle this alone.

scoring.description: Weighted sum scoring with emphasis on self-harm indicators. Provides graduated response based on symptom severity.
